citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The institution’s Semi-annual Program Review dated December 19, 2024, is incomplete. The following sections of the
review were not completed and there is no indication if these areas were found acceptable or if deficiencies were found:
Pages 7-8, Section 1 (subpart Veterinary Care). Clinical Care and Management
Page 9, Section 2 (subpart Veterinary Care). Animal Care, Transportation, Preventative Medicine
Pages 9-10, Section 3 (subpart Veterinary Care). Surgery
Page 10, Section 4 (subpart Veterinary Care). Pain, Distress, Anesthesia and Analgesia
Pages 10-11, Section 5 (subpart Veterinary Care). Euthanasia
Page 5, Section 9. Personnel Qualifications and Training
Page 12, Section 12. Investigating and Reporting Animal Welfare Concerns
Thorough implementation, completion and documentation of the facility’s Semi-annual Program Review helps to ensure
that the facility is currently meeting USDA Animal Welfare Act requirements for the care and use of animals.
The IACUC shall review and document, at least once every six months, the research facility’s program for humane care
and use of animals, using CFR 9, Chapter 1, Subchapter A – Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation.
Correct from this report date forward.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On the IACUC approved protocol # IACUC20230068, under the section for animal housing, the description for animal
housing/study location is listed as: “off-site study location, not institution, private ranch.” There is no additional facility
location information. Also, under the housing section of the protocol application there is a box indicating if there is a
Memorandum of Understanding with the facility where study activities and animal housing are to take place. This is
marked “N/A” on the protocol.
In discussion with the Research Integrity and Compliance Administrator and the Interim Attending Veterinarian, it was
revealed that the IACUC has not visited the site and no MOU has been established because no specific location has yet
been determined by the PI for housing the animals and conducting the study.
This protocol was approved without establishing a site location where animals will be housed and research activities
conducted. This is a category E vaccine trial and challenge study. As a yet to be determined site, the IACUC cannot
reasonably determine whether the site meets USDA Animal Welfare Act requirements for the intended activities and
species used.
The IACUC shall determine that proposed activities meet the requirements of CFR 9, Chapter 1, Subchapter A, including
animals’ living conditions, which will be appropriate for the species and in accordance with part 3 of this subchapter.
No regulated activity shall be conducted until the IACUC can support that the site location meets appropriate study and
species requirements as outlined under the Animal Welfare Act.
Correct from this report date forward.
The animal facilities inspections were conducted with the NDSU Research Integrity and Compliance Administrator
(IACUC and IBC Administrator), The NDSU Interim Attending Veterinarian, The NDSU Farms Manager and the respective
animal unit managers. The inspection of IACUC documents was conducted with the NDSU Research Integrity and
Compliance Administrator. The exit interview was conducted with the NDSU IACUC and IBC Administrator, the NDSU
Interim Attending Veterinarian, and the NDSU Farms Unit Manager.
